5D973DB837A9487EB0C91B1F0274F2BA.description: Demonstrate critical listening behaviours including: filtering distractions, demonstrating a willingness to tolerate ambiguity and exploring multiple perspectives; analyzing and evaluating explicit and implicit messages, concepts, viewpoints, theme and tone; formulating and supporting conclusions about the ideas under discussion; using effective note-making strategies; analyzing oral texts in relation to specific criteria; and, preparing and presenting critical responses.

DA044E5469DE47D89F448DF897A76026.description: Engage in reflective, analytical, empathic and appreciative listening.

815E77B8B5BF4FB3A9C0BAE383B68866.description: Discuss conventions of aural communication in various cultures, including First Nations and Métis.

423D577EF6844B0191C01712DFEE91B9.description: Understand and apply language cues and conventions to construct and confirm meaning when listening.

F778BDCF72864314B22EC42A51D76627.description: Select, use and evaluate critically a variety of before, during and after strategies to construct meaning when listening.

2EBACAA162184DF489D0EE98E7B1D5C1.description: Listen to and interact appropriately with others to communicate and explore understandings, information, ideas and opinions.

62208EE04A4448709020D286E0E138CF.description: Listen to, comprehend and interpret information and ideas, about creative writing, presented in informal and formal situations.

B2418EB4CDD548E48F7049847D3560E8.description: Employ oral presentation elements (e.g., articulation, pronunciation, volume, tempo, pitch, eye contact, facial expression, gestures and poise) appropriate for purpose and audience.

989239EB04CB41F789D3DB14A5B255D8.description: Use a variety of formative assessment tools when conferring with peers and teachers about writing

F1AD6B216C3744A09571BC1B7C3AD118.description: Use oral language to contribute to small and large-group discussions: Establish the purpose and set goals., Clarify individuals' roles and responsibilities, Establish and maintain relationships, Build on the ideas of others and contribute relevant information and ideas., Question others respectfully but also critically., Analyze oral statements made by self and others. and Clarify and elaborate upon own ideas when necessary.

2B716133E39B43EABCC950A60895D6FD.description: Adjust language and tone to suit audience, purpose and situation.

5B8319B41A5C414B9FF07AEDB71F56DE.description: Understand and apply the language cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when speaking.

71154F2ADEF44A31BC4402BCA276A847.description: Select, use and evaluate critically a variety of before, during and after strategies to construct meaning when speaking.

DECF91CC3C6F41339ADA1E18EC104399.description: Use oral language to explore own and others’ ideas and to express understanding.

8359D5ED82D5470598B4CD72DCEA9FC7.description: Speak to communicate ideas and information, related to creative writing, in informal and formal situations.

D4B79FC62A5946A6B02F889D06D2D2DB.description: Discuss legal and ethical issues (e.g., authorship, copyright, ownership and cultural appropriation) associated with the craft of writing.

86344DB1A46143E692F21F4ED579F94C.description: Explore the career experiences of creative writers (e.g., poet, novelist, playwright, travel writer and sports or news correspondent).

4D4556C458D847429EDB76A86414AE76.description: Experiment with writing techniques and styles to develop own creative processes, writing skills and habits.

59FD3280271E4F708905DBA68510BD03.description: Compare different texts to explore how writers communicate similar ideas, information or issues.

053DCC341FA6414CBD25150B8CD7574E.description: Examine the relationship between reading and writing and work to develop own reading habits.

8C539D4DDD164A5B86032BB2D2DE9D32.description: Research writing processes used to organize thoughts, explore ideas and communicate meaning.

E165F45E670C4ADFAD5E5C4D1F8FC2CD.description: Interpret and discuss the use of language and literary devices in a range of texts, considering the personal, cultural, political and historical contexts in which they were created.

A5F67EDC3FD94C2EA387DF22D8C4BB6F.description: Examine strategies and techniques that writers employ to develop their ideas and to present them in fresh and interesting ways.

590BDE081F7945529E9CD96C271F8014.description: Explore creative processes and writing techniques in a variety of visual, multimedia, oral and print mentor texts.

E7989AC2EDF3439BB37C904E196A1D38.description: Investigate mentor texts as resources to inform the craft of creative writing.

B8D31C4FE6A74FA3B5E397BC5A32202E.description: Examine legal and ethical issues (e.g., authorship, copyright, ownership and cultural appropriation) associated with using sources of inspiration in personal and public compositions.

47214D17C311485C89FC1876C271E0A7.description: Document ideas, feelings and reflections using tools such as journals, recordings and sketches.

E112DF8CE0DC4A86AA2628C2F025A116.description: Explore writing as an opportunity to enhance understanding of self, others and the world.

8A126AB2683542048BF45788B5B97C4C.description: Consider how historical, cultural, political and social contexts influence the presentation of ideas, themes and issues in texts.

B4BE9E3DA12D4E25A4C571BDBC370DCF.description: Think critically, creatively and reflectively to explore ideas within, between and beyond texts.

708F6A892DC840A395D49F42C9EE41C9.description: Explain ways that society and culture shape and are shaped by the content, forms and language of texts.

0CA47065CDFF4F739083647F23FC5274.description: Connect ideas, observations, opinions and emotions to understand and appreciate texts.

CB25A2E372C74A03AFAFC38FF7CF477B.description: Examine traditional and contemporary visual, multimedia, oral and written texts that present different viewpoints and perspectives on issues related to identity and social responsibility

139C27EF75D942BEA1DD80F574913DDB.description: Explore sources of inspiration (e.g., conversations, experiences, memories, objects, observations and sounds) as a starting point for personal and public compositions.

1779B01617854BFAA10558D1393D4822.description: Investigate visual, multimedia, oral and written texts as sources of inspiration for creative writing.
